page.title: 04CARNBEE RESERVOIR
page.content: Carnbee reservoir was built in 1929, it is an earth dam. The reservoirs total capacity of water is 50.6 million gallons. The reservoirs water surface is 15 acres and the surrounding area all together is 180 acres. The maximum depth is 32 feet. The reservoir only serves round the coast that is Crail, Kilrenny, Anstruther, Pittenweem, St. Monans and Elie. During 1984 when the water level was very low everybody had to reduce the amount of water they used. People were told not to wash their cars so often. Carnbee Reservoir is situated to the west of this square. At the back of the reservoir is Carnbee Law. Carnbee Law is 142m in height. Carnbee Law is used by the farm near-by for grazing.
